message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper deals with the problem of jointly estimating multiple sparse Undirected Graphical Models (UGMs) from aggregated samples across several contexts. This problem is relevant to several fields, including bioinformatics and neuroimaging, and is related to topics such as machine learning, data mining, and statistics. The paper proposes a novel approach, SIMULE, to learn multi-UGM via a constrained L1 minimization. The approach can handle both Gaussian and Nonparanormal data, which relaxes the normality assumption that many real-world applications do not follow. The paper provides a theoretical proof of the consistency of the proposed approach. Based on these characteristics, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), and cs.IT (Information Theory).
